summary: Catfish are a diverse group of fish named for their cat-like whiskers. They vary in size, from giant species like the Mekong giant catfish to tiny parasitic ones. Not all catfish have visible whiskers. They are defined by their skull and swimbladder structure. Catfish are important for food and the aquarium trade. Some are active at night, while others are active during the day or twilight hours.
title: Catfish
